website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option suitable for the whole family.
pros: Incredibly easy to set up – just inflate and fill
The best pool for those who need a quick and easy option that won’t break the bank
cons: Not as durable as a steel-frame pool

customer_reviews.title: but this is a wonderful way to cool off or just relax in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could have a big pool, but this is a wonderful way to cool off or just relax in the heat of summer. I often get in after working in the yard, and my grandchildren love it. It sits at the back of our patio, so it is easily accessible, and we use it often. I like the filter, as it makes keeping it clean much easier, and I bought some chemicals to keep it chlorinated and pH balanced. I am considering giving this to my daughter so I can justify buying the 12 x12 pool! It was a great purchase, and I would do it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Owens

customer_reviews.title: What's a review worth?
customer_reviews.text: 364 days ago, I purchased this pool, under Amazon Prime, for $49.95. It lasted the season fine, but as the season ended, the plastic started to deflate. I really wasn't worried about it because it served it's purpose. THIS YEAR, the same exact pool increased in cost to $399.95, without Amazon Prime, which means you get it when it's shipped from China, where it is made. I spoke to Amazon Prime via CHAT, since they no longer take calls, and they said there is nothing that they can do. I even wrote a prior review but it was not acceptable to Amazon. So, what is a review worth? Your guess is as good as mine.
customer_reviews.author: All True NO BS Review

customer_reviews.title: Leaks,Leaks and more Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in early March and the weather just got nice enough to set it up and now can’t return it since it’s May. I was about halfway full and I realized it had a small leak on the side. I went ahead patched it and moved on. Then when I was finished I noticed the drain valve doesn’t seal and leaks as well. So I tried to patch it as well as I could the noticed 2 more pinhead size holes in the size that I again patched. I just hope this lasts the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Came with a slow leak. Lasted a week.
customer_reviews.text: This came with a leak. After extensive site prep and laying out a thick expensive tarp underneath, I discovered a slow leak. Never could find it. The pool lasted 1 week before the entire thing drained out. A brilliant idea. If you are lucky enough to get one without any holes, it's probably a great product for a month or two (which was all I was actually hoping for). It's just that there is no way to test the liner without filling it. So you never know what you got. A pool for $50? Too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Teloniusfunk

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: the pool was set up on July 21st. the air ring had a pin hole which we found and sealed which flex tape. One week later the pool collapsed. we filled it again only to have it empty into our yard. this is our second Intex 8 ft pool, last summer's pool also had holes in both the air ring and the liner. we use a 10 foot foam mat underneath, and purchased two covers so far, and upgraded the pump. the pump that comes with the pool is completely inefficient. I tried to attach a picture however, Amazon's site seems to have blocked this option at the moment. I would give 0 stars if that was an option!!
customer_reviews.author: Patti H.

customer_reviews.title: Keeping pump lines elevated is key! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best investment. It has kept our 5 year old busy at home during summer! In a nutshell: - great product for the money -the pump is NOT easy to assemble, but doable -pump does work decently when the pump lines are elevated... see photo.. when pump lay flat on ground, pump does not work -buy chlorine tablets and floater to keep pool clean to avoid emptying water -definitely worth the money! Don’t hesitate to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality pool. However the sizing is deceptive as its the exterior dimensions. Inside diameter of the inflatable top ring is 6 1/2 feet and the water depth is 23 inches.
customer_reviews.author: drcoonerman

customer_reviews.title: This thing is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: You can fit nine 12 year old girls in this. Go ahead, set one up just ten hours before your daughter's 12th birthday party and see. You can fit two adults in blow-up floating chairs in this. Go ahead, put on a baseball game and relax with a beer while floating in it. It's stupidly fun. The filter is underpowered, and you'll need to rinse off the paper if your pool gets too green, but it kinda works pretty good for what this is: cheap cooling off and floating fun.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wanko

customer_reviews.title: i must have got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: heat came early in late spring. I set this up easily. The next day, the air ring was low on air. I filled it up again. The next day it was low again. filled up again and same thing. I must have gotten a bad one. I was going to return but then it started to rain. Wouldnt have been able to return it cause i didnt have time to dry it to send it back. Ended up being a waste of money for me. Ive had a few of these before and never had this issue. Probably a good idea to test the air ring for a day/night before completely setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Just like the name says
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up! It's just the right size for my 4 year old to have a great time. I can get in with her and we can play or we can have a few kids in there. The pump was easy to set up and works well. My only wish is for a vacuum that works with this pump. The cover (definitely recommend!) got blown off in a storm and we had a fair bit of debris. I used the skimmer net tomget it out but I would rather have vacuumed.
customer_reviews.author: From Hanahan

customer_reviews.title: Buy something better
customer_reviews.text: Not very long lasting. Don't move it to a different spot because it will just develop a leak in the ring. I emptied it and was careful when moving. Short story - it got a leak in the ring and I was unable to find the source so I scrapped it. Probably would have been fine if I had not had to move it, but I suspect that taking it down for the winter would have had the same effect.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Dame

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and very stable
customer_reviews.text: Its on the patio outside the master bedroom sliding door, on the concrete and Covered by the patio walls and ceiling for privacy. The patio is level, the back yard is flat but not truly level so we did not want it lopsided. Been up for 2 months, I change the filter once a week and add chlorine every other week in the floating holder. so easy to maintain and the water does not get warm as it does out in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: beckashley

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy anything from this company. They don't honor their warranty and our pump broke within 30 days. They told us to cut a 1' x 1' square out of the pool and send the picture, "just make sure we have it within 90 days" we sent it within 60 and I had to email 3 times to get a response and then they said we needed to contact the manufacturer. Well the manufacturer won't warranty a pool with a huge hole in it.
customer_reviews.author: Bsiren

customer_reviews.title: Love this pool
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased; last year was our pool-trial-run and the whole balancing chemicals thing was a learning curve. So we got the smaller one again this year. I believe I have perfected the water. It's perfect for my 5 year old. We put some foam insulation sheets underneath of it as someone suggested on the reviews (such a FANTASTIC idea). Great price. Maybe next year we will get a larger pool, but this is great for now!
customer_reviews.author: Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and durable. Great summer fun!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVED this pool. Super easy to set up AND has a pump! Such a great value because pumps can get really expensive. We set it up on our concrete patio. Lasted all summer and it would have lasted way longer if we would have taken it down before bonfire season. A few too many embers blowing around left some hard to repair holes but that was our own fault. We got another, bigger one for this year!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Like the concept, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of this product and the price is ok but it is really poor quality. After 2nd use we got a puncture on one of the sides (huge leak). We fixed it (sort of) with tape. After a copule more days we found several smaller leaks all around the pool, the filter leaked lots of water as well. We clear the floor from any sharp object/little rocks that might damage the pool, we purchased the floor mat and the cover. We did everything we could to look after our new swimming pool but in the end, it waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Top opening is about 6' 3" inside measurement on the 8' pool.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little smaller then what I was expecting. The actual measurement inside the top ring is about 6' 3" on ours. The 8' measurement must come from the bottom corners. The reviews saying they have 6 people comfortably in this thing must be hobbits. Lucky our kids are still small and it works for us for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Mason C

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Edit to add the filter stopped working!!! So irritated do not buy this pool!!!!!!Should have listened to the 1 star reviews but I should have known you get what you pay for. Total waste of money. 1. Filter does not work 2. Leaks at the seems as previous posters stated 3. Missing a secure “zip tie” that goes on the tubes that connects to the pool to keep them attached.
customer_reviews.author: A Nors

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, espectially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The pool set up easy and as instructed. There is no ground sheet provided even though the instruction lead you to believe there is on included, there is not. The pool itself is a good deal. The Filter and pump are another matter. The instruction are not very good at all. I just gave up and looked and the illustration on the box. But you really shouldn't even bother. This pump is WAY TOO SMALL for do anything. A complete waste of effort, it does nothing. As one other reviewer suggested, find a much larger pump and order it and just throw the other away.
customer_reviews.author: Tucsonian

customer_reviews.title: nice pool
customer_reviews.text: As hard as I tried to level area, it still filled up kinda oblong. But it does not matter, we enjoy it very much as is. The filter has way too many parts to assemble for me, so we do not use it, I put in one chlorine tablet in a skimmer. Water is crystal clear, I cover at night with tarp to keep leaves and bugs out. Our 7 yr old grandson fits in with me with plenty of room to relax and play.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not what I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: We have had this pool for three months. So far it’s not bad to assemble as long as you have a perfectly level surface and are willing to constantly work at getting the wrinkles out while filling. The filter is absolute junk, we do everything we are suppose to do and the filter is pointless. This has already sprung a leak on the side randomly but the patches did work to fix it. The air filled ring will not stay filled with air. If I were giving advice, I would say get something different.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I had to send the first one back because it ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to send the first one back because it had a hole in the pool the second one I received had a hole in the inflatable ring which I patched however it still keeps leaking air so I will not be ordering a replacement because I'm tired of patching holes.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Pool is great but filter/pump is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: For $50, this is great. Setup isn’t bad - takes time to flatten the creases out as it fills but that’s not a big deal. You can blow the ring up with your mouth or small air compressor in no time. It’s a great height where adults can sit comfortably and lean their head back, and kids 2+ in age can stand without issue. The filter is terrible though. Mine died in less than 6 weeks and I use it maybe every other day for a few hours. Just stopped turning on and pumping water back into the pool. But for $50 I didn’t really expect much more
customer_reviews.author: Jason Weingarten

customer_reviews.title: Need to change the filter every four or five days with heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: Our five Grandchildren stay with us for a month every summer. We liv in Wisconsin. I used two 4x8 sheets of half inch white Styrofoam on the concrete driveway to insulate and protect the pool bottom. I did not trim the excess styrofoam and it got into the pool on there little feet. Next year I will put a tarp done on the syrofoam to eliminate that problem. Two leaks that happened 7 days after it started being used were caused by a pet dog that wanted to join in the fun.
customer_reviews.author: JC WI

customer_reviews.title: 8 foot pool
customer_reviews.text: I could not love this pool more! We investigated getting a "real" pool installed in our backyard to the tune of over $50K. Rather than that, we figured this year, we'd try this little inflatable pool. I LOVE it. It is a tiny investment and is exactly what we wanted! It is easy to put together, holds somewhere around 600 gallons and is wonderful for 4 adults to sit in and have drinks at the pool! It comes with a filter and I just bought the little test strips and a chlorine floater. Works fantastic. We are now considering forgoing the "real" pool and sticking with this!
customer_reviews.author: taximom212

customer_reviews.title: I'd absolutely buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so impressed with this little pool. It's easy to put up, the filtration system is awesome and easy to put together - I love this pool. Over the last 20 years I've had a half dozen above ground pools from this size up to 15'x30' and this new style is awesome. Well worth the price I paid, easy to maintain, I absolutely love it!!! I would buy it in a larger size if I had the space. Highly recommended! This seller was great too!
customer_reviews.author: J. Shore

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of crap EVER!! I was SO excited to get this until I finally set it up, got it half full. Went back to finish filling in the morning and the ring around the top was inflated.....leaks everywhere! DON'T waste your time or money on this trash! Now I need to figure out how to package it back up and send it back 😒👎
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Dont get
customer_reviews.text: 3 Times in floating and has a hole!! I am 63 years old. No pets or children so I wouldn't recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie May

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy. Covid price gouging made the price rise by 100%
customer_reviews.text: Great inflatable pool. You really do need to ensure the ground is level and smooth. Take the time to doubly check for wrinkles after first start to fill. No big deal just understand it will weight 100s of lbs when filled Kids have love the pool. Easy to get in and out. do get a cover to keep things out and help heat the pool. Due to the design of the pool it does not retain heat well.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Cassells

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I only give this pool four stars because we did experience some leakage around one of the filter ports. We managed to stop the leak. The pool has been up and running for about a month with no further problems. It's a good size for my six year old grandson. The pool was not expensive. I'm not sure how easy this will be to take down, store and set up again next year, but if we get one season out of it we got our moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: D Sully

customer_reviews.title: Once you figure out the instructions....not bad!
customer_reviews.text: Although the instructions said that it would take 30 minutes to set up, my teenage daughter and I spent 90 minutes figuring out all of the parts and connections. We positioned the pool on our patio but due to the design (tapered top), we realized too late that it was not completely level and too close to the patio edge....still a good pool (so far) for the money. The drainage attachment on the side is awesome but could be lower...once the water gets below the drain plug, it's tough to empty. Hope that it lasts another summer.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful except for the filter
customer_reviews.text: We got our old one through this summer so will look forward to it next summer.Been through 3 or 4 of these keeping each for about 3 years before replacing.Filter is not good but these pools are godsent.We got rid of the big pool as I was the only one using it and it was lots of work,especially at seasons beginning.These stay clear,warm up quickly due to their size and are perfect for me to float around and relax.in between I happily garden which I'd be too hot to keep up with if I wasn't nice and cool.Get one,they are great!
customer_reviews.author: WOODY

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own pump and hardware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased may 22 2019 pump broke June 27 2019 A lot of the connections leak so we had to buy new hardware for those. We only used the pump on days that we used the pool. Never continuous use. (Based in other reviews) I’d say the pool overall is great. The hardware, hoses and pump are what fail. A little over a month of use and it’s messed up. Which of course is too late to ask for a return or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this just prior to eastern heat wave and it was very nice to have something to cool off in. Grandkids love it because it is a good depth for them to stand in and play. Only complaint is it did not come with hose clamps for me to attach the filter hoses. Just took it down for the season and dried it out well. Hope it is still good next season but if not for the money I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: TH13

customer_reviews.title: another leaker
customer_reviews.text: this is the second 8 ft. pool I"ve purchased in two years . just set this one up ,it leaks just like the first .the seams on the bottom just won:t take the pressure from the water it"s only going to get worse when they start using it a lot . I wonder how to return it.buyer beware not recomended
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective wading pool for adults!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pool. Perfect for our needs. Easy to assemble and maintain. I did discover they are not kidding when they tell you to smooth out all the wrinkles before filling. Once we got all the wrinkles smoothed out in the bottom, it worked like a dream. The pool does not come with an air pump, but we have one for our air mattress. It would be worth the investment for inflating the ring. We aren’t using the included pump at the moment, but we did invest in a chlorine dispenser and ‘small pool’ tabs.
customer_reviews.author: Subrosali

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer Customer Support Is Non-Existent
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the Intex 8x30 Easy Set Pool on 4/29/20 (at a much higher than normal price) and discovered the inflatable ring no longer held air. This was after the Amazon return window but within the Intex 90 day warranty period. Numerous attempts to contact the manufacturer were made but we received no response. There is zero customer support from this company.
customer_reviews.author: AL PM

customer_reviews.title: Love this Pool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small pool for the adults to enjoy in the backyard during the summer. I have used it approximately 4 summers at this point and it is still holding strong! The filter system works great, the depth is decent and the quality of the vinyl/siding is excellent. I have bought additional supplies to keep the pool clean, including replacement filters, a pool cover and chlorine tablets, but maintenance is minimum overall and I couldn't be happier! This is a lovely way to stay cool during hot summer months - would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bootsin

customer_reviews.title: Is nice other just to set down in and cool off
customer_reviews.text: Top ring is a pain in the ass to patch if it ever gets a pin hole in it. We had issues with birds and cats constanty hitting the rim. I also think the pump and filter is to small to keep the water filtered. Is nice other just to set down in and cool off.
customer_reviews.author: keith estes

customer_reviews.title: Easy set more like instant collapse!
customer_reviews.text: My mom had this pool and i decided to get the same one , well i was not impressed at all , i was never able to get it all flat the top ring never could get fully inflated and it never held water and collapsed every time i tried to fill it up , the filter just sprayed water everywhere, easy set is not easy set
customer_reviews.author: Yarrow First Hartling

customer_reviews.title: It's probably worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's probably worth the money. Makes my grandkids happy...Instructions are quite general as it covers many pool sizes. Good thing for pictures! After filling the pool I discovered a pin hole the next morning. I wasn't about to drain it so I patched under water with some rubber cement and a piece of clear plastic bag. The hole appears to be at the point of one of the folds and not a seam. It's holding for now. Not worth going through the aggravation of draining, repackaging and returning...uuuhhh
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: The pool is leaking after 1 month of use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to setup, and use. After regular use of the pool, even if it is properly set (I put it in garage on almost ideal surface and used heavy duty cover under), it is start leaking all around the bottom. It looks like materials are not durable or I've got defective item.
customer_reviews.author: SM23

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For $40 this pool is the perfect size for filling and draining. We decided to use this for longer than 3-4 days, so we installed the filter. It came with 4 hose clamps that were too big (also, you need 8). So we had to buy 8 hose clamps (~$15). If they provided the clamps I would have given 4 stars. Also, The first one delivered had holes in it. The second one worked fine. Update: We love this pool! So easy to fill and drain. Now that we are using the filter, with a little chlorine, it is so easy to maintain. Also, we purchased the cover so there is no external leaves when we are not in it.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Reamer

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: I got this same model last year and gave it to a family member and bought it again. The pump has to run an hour or two a day and you do need to buy extra filters to replace often. I change them every 10-14 days. Luckily, the filters are cheap. Really easy to setup and quite durable. My cat decided to pop the top ring once. Only once, he learned that lesson. lol. But, the pool comes with some extra rubber and i had to buy the glue to fix it myself. I still give it a 5 though. Solid pool, really.
customer_reviews.author: Zacary Nuttall

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Find Locally
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these several years ago at a WalMart 50 or so miles down the mountain. Wore it out and tried to buy a replacement. The smallest portable pool they sell at the store now is 10' in diameter. So had to order this one online. Works fine. The 10' pool wouldn't leave much room on our porch here at the ranch, so this one is perfect for us. THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: Al Price

customer_reviews.title: great for correct expectations
customer_reviews.text: This pool is so much fun for smaller kids. My 5 year old loves it. It is a smaller pool, so don't expect too much out of it. The instructions are horrible, but there are YouTube videos if you cant figure it out. aside from having a true in-ground pool, my kids and the neighbors appreciated this a lot. I even enjoyed jumping in to cool off and i am 6'3".
customer_reviews.author: DWGreviewer

customer_reviews.title: my twin 5yos love it. very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: pros: big enough for anyone under 10. maybe even two at once. maybe. my twin 5yos love it. very easy to setup. seems well constricted. no water leaks so far. cons: top ring needs to be refilled every 3-4 days. Cant find a leak. It has been very hot though. says its 30 inches deep. its actually only 24. the manual -tries to scare you, but its very easy to set up. -has many tasks listed but nearly all are optional unless you have the largest version.
customer_reviews.author: Ruki

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice pool that is easy enough to set up. My husband had to add a clamp to one of the attachments because it didn’t want to stay on, but it was a very easy fix. Also we seem to already have punctured a small hole in the ring, thankfully it comes with a patch.. Overall, we are very pleased with our purchase. We have 4 kids between the ages of 3 & 7 and they all play in it together and love it!
customer_reviews.author: MrsDavis

customer_reviews.title: awesome pool
customer_reviews.text: You must level the ground this pool sits on or it will stretch and fall over. Water is very heavy and equal pressure all around is vital to its survival. That being said, the pool was easy to set up, easy to connect the pump/filter and we were in it about 1/2 a day after starting to assemble it and it is holding up great so far with about 1/2 the summer gone.
customer_reviews.author: David, FL

customer_reviews.title: Bad Pump design Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Intex Easy Set Pool I have purchased. The first was great and lasted a long time. This one has a faulty filter pump. It has a test and reset button which is the only way to turn it off and on besides unplugging it. Worked 2-3 times and now won't turn on. Can't get the company to honor a warranty and had to buy another pump and pay shipping - almost as much a buying a new pool. They won't answer the phone and tell you to go to the website where I found the warranty is for 15 days from date of purchase??? Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: My son and I were very happy when the pool came. It rained the first day but we put it up this week end. The pool had been up 2 days and our excitement is done. The plastic ring around the top is not holding sir. I fill it up 3 or 4 times while he is in the pool. This morning I come you the find have the pools water home the ring deflated over night and the water wasted out. 😭😭😞. I really like the size or was easy set up but how can we use it like that?
customer_reviews.author: Cherece Moore

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and pinholes on bottom no way to check prior to filling
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up. Was very excited about it. Set up under porch on a concrete area to ensure levelness and we layed a carpet for cushion. However as soon as we started to fill we noticed the carpet was soaked and noticed there was a small leak somewhere in bottom, maybe seams we don’t know. We are going to see how long it lasts since we already filled up, but i suppose you get what you paid for. Revised *amazon did a replacement super quickly and the next pool came hole free. Kids enjoyed it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great for the whole family, not just kids
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I thought the size was just for kids, well I'm wrong. I purchased this for just my husband and I to use, and we love relaxing and cooling off on a hot summer's night in the backyard. I have had no issues with this, it's very sturdy. I would recommend for first time buyers to watch a few Youtube videos about set up and maintenance. You do need to make sure the bottom liner is completely spread out when filling the pool to ensure the pool is level without one side tilting. The set up is very quick, easy and hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Kat from Stat

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Set it up fairly easily but small leaks developed in the top air ring, so the pool would not hold water or stand up firmly. Only used it once for about 15 minutes, to just sit in it. Then tried to return and while they say they take returns, MUST be in original box (which of course it will NEVER fit back in) and if it has ever been inflated (duh, how else would you know it was defective), maximum refund is 50% (or I guess maybe 80% but only after "testing"). For the price, was not even worth the effort to try and get a fraction of a refund! DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: This little pool has been a great relief to the heat. I’m on year number 2 with no issues. It’s large enough to have fun with my grandkids in it. The little filter works greats for what’s needed. However can’t belief the inflation of price. I paid 30$ish. Certainly overpriced at the 300$ mark.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: Good for one season; needs often filter replacements.
customer_reviews.text: We had this pool up and running for a couple months last summer. Took caution taking it down and putting it away safely. This year, Put it back up and the air chamber is leaking; somehow - can’t find any hole. And the base has a pinhole that is impossible to patch.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki & Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Came with a leak
customer_reviews.text: We just bough this pool yesterday on amazon, it came today. cleared out an area so there were was a clean spot for the pool. hooked everything up, filled it with water and there is a leak at the seam on the bottom near the side. A complete waste of water now if I have to empty it and send it back. id like a refund or at least send us a patch kit to attempt to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: george smith

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: For $50 bucks, this was one of the best purchases I’ve ever made. It has been a lifesaver in the NC summer. My husband and I both love it, we can both just fit with a float each. Remember, its a $50 pool. I ended up purchasing a bigger filter, because I didnt feel the one with it was doing a very good job. To keep it clean, you’ll need to get chemicals, a vacuum, and a skimmer, so expect to spend a bit more than the $50. Also, its absolutely imperative that its set up on perfectly flat ground. But, greatest decision I ever made, will probably upgrade to a bigger size next year. Totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: kelly d

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: as mentioned previously, the top ring doesn't hold air well. i'm blowing it up every week. i haven't had a problem with water leaking that i've noticed. the pool level seems sufficient. it's decent for the kids but wish i would have just gotten a real pool so they could actually swim, water depth is about 24"
customer_reviews.author: bernadette kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 seasons but great if that's what you need
customer_reviews.text: These have gone way up in price so not as good a deal. I have an 8ft and a 12ft. They stretch ALOT between seasons so but it knowing you will get 2 seasons max...
customer_reviews.author: Renaldy

customer_reviews.title: poor quality components
customer_reviews.text: At first my 5-year old was thrilled! The pool was easy to set up, and provided hours of enjoyment. Then .... problems. The circuit breaker on the plug kept flipping. Finally I took the pump apart, and found that the impeller (?) shaft is split (see photo). I'm not an electician, but my guess is that water inside of this unit was causing the problem. In any event, the pool is useless if the pump doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great pool
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new one of these every year, it's just easier than trying to dry it out and store it during the winter. I've never had an issue with one until this year. This pool had a small hole on the side, rather than draining it and returning or patching with the supplied patch kit I purchased so flex tape which you can use in water and it fixed the problem right away. I would suggest purchasing a larger capacity pump though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Caprini

customer_reviews.title: Cool pool, junk filter
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this five stars...but I can't. After just one week the filter completely took a crap on us. I also chalked up reviews about this to negative nancies but people are telling it true! It was weak to begin with, and then it just quit working. I don't expect a super awesome filter for this cheap price, but regardless...if ya buy a pool with a filter, you hope it will at least filter your pool for more than one week. We love the pool and are excited about it, but are pretty bummed that replacing the filter with one that actually works is probably going to cost us more than the pool itself.
customer_reviews.author: JayRo

customer_reviews.title: It lasted only 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The inflatable ring on top of the pool started leaking air. The pool has been used by my 3 year old and 10 year old girls. The girls loved it, the design is great, and it was fairly easy to assemble. However, the pool is not durable. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: the pump doesnt work and the purge valve leaks
customer_reviews.text: contacted customer service .couldnt understand the lady.i asked to speak to somebody that speaks english. she refused.i have no idea if im getting my parts or not.do not buy.beware very poor customer service.contacted twice more still wont respond.amazon should ban this company from there site.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Price really went up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool in 2018 for $40. Now they want over $300 for same pool. It was a good pool for $40 but not today’s price...
customer_reviews.author: WRC

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again and again ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a great little pool and perfect for a quick dunk to cool off. I have a floating chair that I keep in it for when I want to just chill with a drink or book. Otherwise, for my height (5'4"), if I sit on the bottom, the water is up to my neck.. I had the 10' last year, but it received irreparable dog damage. :( So... I replaced it with this smaller version that fits perfectly on my deck. Word of caution: have a sturdy deck (mine weighs 3760#). I set it up in less than 30 minutes by myself. If you use the filter, setting it up is not as intricate as it might look.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna Howard

customer_reviews.title: Its not leaking .....yet update ring leaks air pump stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Update - So my ring barely has air I have to keep putting more in it hasnt collapsed but it shouldnt be leaking air either also my pump nolonget works only had this for about a month So far so good the 2nd day I had to add more air to the ring but I didnt push in the air plug left on vacation its still standing and not leaking we havent actually gotten to swim in it yet thougj
customer_reviews.author: Ariesaphcelie

customer_reviews.title: Worst Purchase I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase I’ve ever made. Normally I’m a patient person so if something some slightly damaged I won’t complain but I’ve had this pool for a little over a week and spent more money trying to fix the issues with the actual product than anything else. The top was filled with holes and because of that I am unable to fill it. I tried witching it but there were too many holes to even patch. Do yourself a favor and just jump a puddle In your backyard because that will give you more fun than having to deal with this pool.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D Vera

customer_reviews.title: Love the pool definitely
customer_reviews.text: Love the pool definitely!!!! if we have a bigger patio, we could have bought a bigger one but this...LOVELY!!!! and we are enjoying it to the max...this is good if you want your space back for the cold months.....use in warm/hot months then store in cold months....filter should be checked from time to time to make sure it's working and pool tablets should be in as well.... GREAT POOL!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rojap

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This pool was a replacement for a 5 year old pool that was leaking. Easy to set up. Unfortunate, though the pool is leaking, per all instructions you have to contact Intex for any issues. We are waiting for a resolve to the problem, but no reflection on the seller
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality parts
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking this is gonna be great but t the top ring on pool had air hole leaks the next day. Very thin. Just like the cheap blow up kiddie pools. Also drain hole threads defective. Had to put a sandwich baggie on to get it to fit tightly so water quit dripping out. Figured I'd keep it because cost so much to send back.. But the top ring on pool continues to leak air. Patched twice already. Have to pump up every time use it. Little disappointed in quality.. Pool was great size for my grand daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Brown

customer_reviews.title: Problems right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Pin holes in the air ring and leakage from one of the hose connections. Can't find any more holes but the air ring went stay inflated. Want to return it but don't want to do a big dump of water (or refill it again with an iffy replacement). Be sure you consider the cost of potential wasted water. Bought these in the past and never had trouble. Quality had definitely finished significantly Ugh. Same for the cover with the multiple quarter-size holes. What the what??!
customer_reviews.author: Julz

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are horrible, pump failed completely
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to connect all the freaking hoses for over an hour, the directions are TERRIBLE, will give up and return. Easy set NOT. Filter FAILED after 2 months, complete garbage
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: SUPER LITTLE POOL
customer_reviews.text: this little pool was very easy to set up and it's just big enough to be fun. the pump is more than a sufficient size as my water always stays beautifully clear. i can float on a 6' raft comfortably and when i sit in it the water covers my shoulders. i'm very happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: virginia hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a hole, Intext messed up return, can't get money back
customer_reviews.text: The pool arrived with a hole that went through the entire pool into the liner. I called Intex and spoke with them (rude), and they never emailed me the proper information. I called again and was given the website to go to with my claim number. When I attempted to correct the email and fill out the information it was not editable, and I couldn't complete the return. Awful.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Hall

customer_reviews.title: All parts not included
customer_reviews.text: An important piece was missing from the pump system and we had to call for a replacement. We were told that we would not be charged for the replacement since we had already filled the pool and water is very pricey in Colorado. Later we were charged on our Amazon card. I’m not very happy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie D

customer_reviews.title: Great little pool for hot summer days
customer_reviews.text: This pool is great for cooling off in hot weather. Water comes up to chest. Filter system is really good as we have hard water and pool is always clear. Changing filter insert is easy. Inflatable rim is sturdy. Put on very level space as it naturally tilts if not.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Harty

customer_reviews.title: Immediately Leaked in Multiple Places
customer_reviews.text: It leaked in multiple places right out of the box. Both the inflatable part and the pool part leaked. The air in the inflatable part leaked out in an hour, and the pool leaked water immediately upon beginning to fill it, in multiple places. Pretty cruddy for so much money. Boooo
customer_reviews.author: ruehsd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pool to take to the boat races where we couldn’t get in the water! This pool was the perfect size to cool off in and there are plugs for the inlet and outlet so you can use it without the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, but I ordered one
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, but I ordered one, and it had a hole, so I sent it back. I ordered the second, and another hole. I made a repair with Shoe Goo and am filling the pool now, and hoping to not find any more leaks/surprises, otherwise, I'll be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: K. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing pool. A MUST for the summer.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best $45 I’ve ever spent! The pool is absolutely amazing - I wish I bought this years ago. The Amazon reviews are extremely helpful. We put it on our terrace so leveling and the filter weren’t an issue. I think the filter works fine as long as you aren’t counting on it to suck up grass and dirt - for just filtering the water and keeping it clean it seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Mateyko

customer_reviews.title: Sides are different heights. Never filled properly.
customer_reviews.text: It shipped great. But the sides of the pool are different lengths. I have it on a level surface, and I can only fill it about half way due to one side being almost a foot shorter then the other. I tried three different locations and it's the same thing each time, and the same side each time. So I know it's not user error..... Update - I was able to exchange for a new one. Worked perfectly. Easy exchange. I did upgrade the pump to a higher flowing one. Helps keep the water moving..
customer_reviews.author: cmak

customer_reviews.title: I didn't get all of the parts
customer_reviews.text: The pool part is easy to set up. However the pump is impossible to set up since they didn't send me the clamps for the hoses, when I called and complained they were super nice, but they still sent me the wrong size. Save the money and get the pool without the pump! Luckily the pool works without the pump so I don't have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: K. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Holds water (lol) and its a great size foe a smaller back yard.
customer_reviews.text: Great pool for smaller backyard! Takes a lot longer to set it up then the 30 minutes they advertise. Took two plus hours to figure out how to assemble the pump as the directions really suck. The rest of the pool was fairly easy to get set up and start to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Lezlie A H Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Headache
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on accident since I bought it before and returned it. Difficult to get it evenly setup, one side is always lopsided. Buy a better and sturdier pool that actually has a frame and is not supported by evenly distributed water and gravity.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Forman

customer_reviews.title: Seriously a steal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Thick liner even had my dog scratch it because he wanted to jump in, no leaks. Only complaint is that the GFI that is the plug doesn't allow for a timer to be setup for the filter. You have to manually reset it each time power is cut to the filter.
customer_reviews.author: larold

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: We have had a blast in this all summer. Make sure you order extra filters. Been having to change it out once a week. The pool was super easy to set up although I do recommend you have another adult to help or an older teen or child.
customer_reviews.author: dirtfox13

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific pool! It takes two people to set up and goes quickly. It took about 2 hours to fill. I use 3/4 a cup of bleach every other night to keep the water clean. I run the pump after adding the bleach to circulate the water.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak :(
customer_reviews.text: Great size pool for cooling off!!! we followed the directions to the tee in regards to setting it up and when we went outside to use the pool the next day, We found water leaking from a hole on the seam. Not even 12 hours after setting up and there is a slow leak of water. I honestly do not think it was an error on our end but a possible defect with the seam of the pool. I hope that we could patch the seam make it through the rest of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.text: I just received our small pool, and i understood when buying it that it was small and inexpensive, however I at least expected it to be in good condition as new. The clamps that go around the hoses for the pump were not the right size and the hose has a hole it it! Now that we have it set up and full of water, its really a waste to have to drain it and return it. Otherwise its a great lil pool to have as something refreshing during the spring and summer months. Hoping they can send these replacement for us.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Didn't have all seams sealed and now I'm stuck with it since it was a slow week.
customer_reviews.text: Well I learned a harsh lesson... Don't leave purchases sitting for 3 weeks before opening. I purchased this and we left for trips. Came home, caught up on work and then put this together. One of the seams had a slow leak and it was hardly noticeable. I tried to return it but I am literally one day past the return policy and the manufacturer doesn't seem to be willing to do anything. The pump is also not sufficient for the amount of water in this pool. It doesn't circulate well enough at all.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Fay

customer_reviews.title: great overall
customer_reviews.text: It takes some effort and time to set it up and fill it. If you live in the desert it won't stay cool even under the shade. Filter works great there were some minor drips but overall it looks good and works well, a great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: suezjet

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at the seams
customer_reviews.text: Leaks from the bottom corners. The bottom of this pool is not round. There are corners where it's patched together. Almost all of these corners leak. This is a difficult area to patch, and would need 8 large patches to fix. It also leaks from the drain. Update. I used teflon tape to seal the drain threads. that stopped dripping. The top ring has a huge nozzle to inflate, to big to use a standard pump.
customer_reviews.author: Killer B

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th year with my $40. “Disposable “ pool. I had planned on getting a new one this year, but figured what the heck I’ll just set it up and see how it does. It had a tiny leak that was easily repaired and it was all ready for another season. 2 years ago I upgraded the filter. I put in a cup of bleach every other evening while the filter is running. I admit that it doesn’t get a daily workout by a lot of kids, but I use it just about every day and my 2 young grandsons have a blast when they visit! Best $40. I ever spent
customer_reviews.author: Hate to pay too much

customer_reviews.title: Good for one summer only
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price since it only lasted one summer and we barely used it. Had a big tear on the bottom at the end of the summer, but we rarely used it and it was on thick mats. This was not used by children or people being reckless, so its unfortunate that we paid 300$ for something we have to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: josi chapman

customer_reviews.title: Product malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about getting this Pool, knowing Amazon backed it I just knew it would be good quality. Oh my was I surprised, I had it up for only one and a half weeks when I noticed a quarter size hole in the seam of the lining of it. I have no idea what happened but I am so disappointed with the poor quality of this product..
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed for the summer that my wife was pregnant. We didn’t have kids yet so we wanted a small simple pool. This was easy to setup and maintain. My wife is 5’5” and it hit her mid thigh. We didn’t have any leaks with the pump as some reviews have mentioned. Perfect for our 2, 4, and 6 year old nieces/nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Jonman

customer_reviews.title: pump to to small for pool
customer_reviews.text: pin hole in pool had to repair be even using it and pump is not strong enough for the pool---but its set up with all the water so it will have to do the instructions for setting up the pump!! were as clear as mud !!
customer_reviews.author: daniel hill

customer_reviews.title: Small opening
customer_reviews.text: Has to be on perfect level ground otherwise the top will collapse on the side that has the least amount of water. Bottom of pool is very large but top of pool is small and i feel like you lose a-lot of room to swim when the top is narrower than the bottom of pool.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Decamp

product_meta.title: Intex 8ft X 30in Easy Set Pool Set with Filter Pump
product_meta.description: Make a splash all summer long with the Intex Easy Set, one of the most easy to assemble pools on the market. This pool will make your backyard the place to be all summer as your family can relax and play. A 110-120 volt filter pump is included and is very easy to install- just hook up the hoses and enjoy clean refreshing water. Ready for water in 10 minutes, - simply spread out on level ground, inflate the top ring, fill the pool with water, and enjoy the fun! Includes: SUPER-TOUGH laminated PVC sidewalls. 110 - 120 Volt Filter Pump with 330 gallon per hour flow rate. Set-up and maintenance DVD. Convenient drain plug that connects to a garden hose so water can be drained away from pool or house area. Water capacity: (80%) 639 gallons.Customer Support our 800 number at 1-800-234-6839 to work with us to resolve any issues.
feature_bullets: A 110-120 volt filter pump is included and is very easy to install- just hook up the hoses and enjoy clean refreshing water;Age Grading : 6+
Ready for water in 10 minutes, - simply spread out on level ground, inflate the top ring, fill the pool with water, and enjoy the fun!
Includes: SUPER-TOUGH laminated PVC sidewalls. 110 - 120 Volt Filter Pump with 330 gallon per hour flow rate. Set-up and maintenance DVD.
Convenient drain plug that connects to a garden hose so water can be drained away from pool or house area. Water capacity: (80%) 639 gallons.
New dual suction outlet fittings improve water circulation resulting in better water hygiene and clarity.
Do not set up the pool on sand, mud, or any soft or loose soil conditions.; No of People: 2 to 4

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,842 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
